page.title: 07BRAES HOUSING AND HEALTH
page.content: In the past almost all the houses in the Braes were either farms or crofts. With the amalgamation of small crofts into larger units many houses became derelict. Some have now been bought and renovated as holiday accomodation while others are just heaps of stones with a rowan tree close by. In the 1970's the distillery was built with three houses for management and at the same time the Council built six houses mainly for the workforce. The doctor and district nurse from either Tomintoul or Glenlivet provide very good medical care, always willing to make house calls when necessary. Serious cases are sent to hospital in Elgin or Aberdeen. Aberlour and Dufftown have small cottage hospital mainly for geriatric care but the nearest maternity hospital is in Elgin.
